title: jMavSim not happy with EKF2 in HITL mode
body:
Is jMavSim supposed to be happy with the new EKF2 ?  I am also having trouble with HITL simulation where jMavSim flies crazy.  If I do this on 1.5.1 it works better:

    param set SYS_MC_EST_GROUP 1

But that doesn't work on 1.5.2 because the old LPE was removed completely.  So if I re-enable it by editing the src/configs/nuttx_px4fmu-v2_default.cmake file so it looks like this:

	#
	# Estimation modules
	#
	modules/attitude_estimator_q
	#modules/position_estimator_inav
	modules/local_position_estimator
	#modules/ekf2

Then jMavSim HITL simulation is happy again.  Question is whether this was the expected behavior with the changes in 1.5.2 ?  Does jMavSim need updating to work with EKF2 or am I missing some other setup step ?

title: Unsupported baro pollrate set to 150Hz in sensor_init.cpp
body:
Hi guys,

In sensor_init.cpp, polling rate of baro is set to 150Hz which is unsupported by MS5611(default max: 40Hz) and BMP280, by: `h_baro.ioctl(SENSORIOCSPOLLRATE, 150);`
This command also returns ERROR, as it is supposed to happen.

Moreover voter timeout for baro needs to be set to a decent value, the way it is done for mag in sensors.cpp by: `_mag.voter.set_timeout(300000);`

title: FW auto land switch yaw to wheel controller
body:
Large yaw actuation during FW landing flare.

http://logs.uaventure.com/view/XDxR5X5pVEjYNULpojSQdB

![land2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/84712/20872759/3934d320-ba6f-11e6-9dda-a251a1ef1b4e.png)

The main problem is the switch to the wheel controller here - https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/master/src/modules/fw_pos_control_l1/fw_pos_control_l1_main.cpp#L1622
@AndreasAntener @tumbili I think one of you implemented the wheel controller and landing?
How should we solve this? I thought about hiding the switch behind runway takeoff enable, but there are plenty of little planes with steerable landing gear that you might want to hand launch. Should we try to detect touchdown?

The next question is why did the yaw setpoint drop 0 (_target_bearing) instead of maintain yaw?


Reported here - http://discuss.px4.io/t/issues-with-landing-rudder-on-flying-wing/1863/13

body: sending FILE_TRANSFER_PROTOCOL message with opcode kCmdListDirectory with the payload->data set to a non-existant directory "/foo" hangs the Pixhawk in mallinfo(). title: Complex mixer not loading with more than 3 inputs
body:
It seem there is a problem with the mixer module.
When ever you try to use more than 3 inputs in any mixer, it does not load.
Theses inputs can be from any control group, the issues still is present.

If there is a mixer that does not load, the next mixers in the file also won't load.
It does not throw any errors in the console however.
The loaded mixers along with every other function of the flight controller seem to work correctly.

Tests have been done on a hardware bench test using a Pixfalcon/Pixhawk mini and digital AND analog servos.

Example mix that does not work:

M: 4
O: 10000 10000 0 -10000 10000
S: 1 0 2250 2250 0 -10000 10000
S: 1 1 -3750 -3750 0 -10000 10000
S: 0 0 3000 3000 0 -10000 10000
S: 0 1 -5000 -5000 0 -10000 10000

Removing ANY input from the mix makes it work.

title: Crash when flying below the Home Point
body:
When I fly with my Pixhawk in state_HIL simulation with the current master build below the home point altitude, the Pixhawk do strange things:

In **Stabilize Mode** the Pixhawk is unable to rotate around the YAW axis. After flying above the relative altitude of zero, the yaw rotation ability comes back.

In **Altitude- and Position-Hold Mode** the Pixhawk suddently crashes to the ground when I fly below a relative altitiude of zero (rotor rotation stops). After switching to stabilize mode and fly above the home point I can reproduce all this behaviour.

Can someone confirm/reproduce this?

title: VTOL: FW flight very strange lock down in Loiter.
body:
Hi guys,

We've had a very strange case in witch once we've transitioned, we put the plane in Loiter manually, and from then on the VTOL just stopped responding. It disconnected from QGC and started Loiter but with Cruise speed, and not min airspeed. We switched off the RC to make it failsafe to no avail. It just continued circling. We tried everithing possible but nothing happened. At some point the batteries just started to die and the plane just landed very nice in Loiter. I must say the TECS just did a brilliant work. 

We could not find the reason, because the LOG file just stopped recording very soon in to the flight. And the other logs are very ordinary.

http://logs.uaventure.com/view/dAEJ87t6rCy5qw7MqmAKkC

This is from the messages log:

2016_11_02_14_45_12: ARMED by RC
2016_11_02_14_45_13: [blackbox] /fs/microsd/log/2016-11-02
2016_11_02_14_45_13: [blackbox] recording: 14_45_11.px4log
2016_11_02_14_45_18: Takeoff detected

nothing more.

And here is the PreFlight log again normal log.

[preflight_perf14_45_11.txt](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/files/569289/preflight_perf14_45_11.txt)


It was on PixFalcon with the digital airspeed.

The plane was holding the loiter brilliantly all the time, so the GPS must have been working. The TECS were brilliant. Just it did not respond to our RC nor the our Telemetry connection. The telemetry was having a green light which mean there was a connection between the telemetry modules, but there was no obvious traffic.

Version 1.5RC1

title: land detector start last
body:
I was getting landed state undefined in QGC using SITL. Apps starting after land detector won't have the initial landed state.

Would it be safer to publish landed state periodically, or do something to make sure it publishes after boot is complete?

The configs using px4.config are probably still not right, but I moved them for consistency.

title: rcS: move check for PWM input up
body:
pwm_input was not working correctly (only after a pwm_input reset) on
Pixracer because fmu was started on all PWM output channels.

This moves the check if PWM input is needed up before the fmu start.

Tested on Pixracer and Pixhawk (for both it's FMU port 5).

title: get() doesn't fetch a new param value if previous value was 0 unless rebooted
body:
I have spotted it in the navigator, but I guess it will apply to all the places where `get()` function is used to fetch parameter values.

If param value is non-zero and it is changed via QGC, then it works fine. However, once it is set to 0, and then it is changed, the new value is no longer fetched until the system is rebooted.

Below is a summary:

title: Mission: Immediate command triggering after un-pausing
body:
When flying a mission with VTOL, and current active waypoint is either VTOL Takeoff or VTOL Land, if you pause a mission and then un-pause it, aircraft will do transition immediately without regard to the acceptance radius. 

I can imagine this issue will concern any waypoint that contains some command in it. Essentially, this command is triggered right after un-pausing a mission.

title: loss of manual_control (loss of rc)
body:
Scenario: flying using manual_control mavlink messages

When the ground station stops to send manual_control the rc link should go into failsafe - at the moment it is being kept active all the time resulting in fly-away.

From my investigations:
- mavlink_receiver (MavlinkReceiver::handle_message_manual_control) - only publishes rc input values when manual_control message arrives (it never sets rc.rc_lost to true)
- Sensors::rc_poll() expects rc.rc_lost to be set in order to trigger failsafe

I can think of 2 solutions:
- MavlinkReceiver to implement some kind of timer on manual_control, after which rc is published with rc_lost=true (this would only be active in certain COM_RC_IN_MODE)
- Sensors::rc_poll() to keep track of last updated rc_input and to fallback into failsafe after timeout

Any views on this?

title: MC attitude septoints are zero when motors are saturated. v 1.4.4
body:
I experienced several times while flying hex copter in wind conditions around 6 m/s:
12_08_23.px4log
![pasted image at 2016_10_10 13_48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7020958/19237380/747fafd2-8ef4-11e6-9fde-36f231eb24f1.png)

In PosControl the copter saturates from around 84s till 88s. You can see how desired pitch (and roll as well, you could see from logs) jumps from stabilizing copter to zero. Sometimes (86.5s - 87s) you can see that desired pitch goes back to stabilize when the motors are still saturated, but I believe it might be somewhere on the boundary of saturation and it unblocks the attitude control.

But it seems that copter will start to stabilize attitude even when the motors are saturated if you give an rc input, like you can observe on the picture below. At around 270.5 it goes from off-board to poscontrol mode while motors are full up and only 272, when the rc input for position change are given the desired attitude starts to be non-zero.
10_03_49.px4log
![pasted image at 2016_10_10 13_47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7020958/19237926/1a04de08-8ef7-11e6-8858-8a78a309ec63.png)

If it's intentionally made that multirotors don't keep the attitude when the motors are full powered in order to keep altitude, I don't think it's the best idea. When the copter start to suddenly fly away without you commanding it and completely neglecting wind in my opinion more dangerous if it would slowly go down while still trying to fight the wind.    

[Link](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B4HSR_JQFK8KRVhJNVpHQ2NJZFk?usp=sharing) to px4logs.

title: Descend mode when landed
body:
If there is no RC and gps connection (so possible workshop conditions), and aircraft is armed, then it will immediately go to auto descend mode. This essentially triggers landing on the current position. However, because aircraft is already on the ground, the ground detection in MPC fails since [it requires aircraft to move downwards firstly](https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/master/src/modules/mc_pos_control/mc_pos_control_main.cpp#L1722-L1727). 
Additionally, MPC will set the thrust setpoint to `MPC_THR_MIN` which is enough to spin up the props (dangerous on its own). With that, land detector will detect takeoff, and it will stay in this mode forever unless, for example, min. thrust is enough to cause tipping of the aircraft.

title: Home point not set due to recent commit
body: On stable, the drone sets the home point as soon as it gets a good gps position. This works in HITL (with xplane) and in the real world. On master, the home point does not get set. After disabling the changes made by https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/commit/50b8ed0a89d2a6022cc518df65fa6bc57375f393 , it does set the home point as before.

title: Fix for mavlink uORB subscription corner case
body:
This fixes a corner case where the first advertise/publish of a
vehicle_command_ack was missed. What happened was that the
orb_subscribe_multi was not called until the topic had been published
and therefore orb_exists was happy. This means that by the time
orb_subscribe_multi was finally called, the first vehicle_command_ack
was already history and not detected by orb_check.

Tested in SITL, needs quick regression checking on a NuttX platform.

What kind of bug can cause phenomena like that, it's really fatal error....

title: Error building posix_sitl_default
body:
Hi, 

I'm getting an error while building PX4 for SITL simulation with Gazebo. I installed the pre-requisites as stated in [this page](http://dev.px4.io/simulation-gazebo.html) and ran `make posix_sitl_default gazebo`. I got the following error:

```
--   Found protobuf, version 3.0.2
Gazebo version: 7.3
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:80 (message):
  protobuf version: 3.0.2 not compatible, must be >= 2.5.0 and < 3.0.0


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

So it appears that the protobuf version I have is too new, therefore I downloaded the newest version below v3.0.0 (as the error log is suggesting) which is v2.6.1 and I installed it. Then I proceeded to re-run the build as follows:

```
make posix_sitl_default clean
make posix_sitl_default gazebo
```

I get a new error which is very long, but I'll only display the beginning since it says where it does come from:

```
In file included from SensorImu.pb.cc:5:
In file included from ./SensorImu.pb.h:27:
/usr/local/Cellar/gazebo7/7.3.1_4/include/gazebo-7/gazebo/msgs/quaternion.pb.h:12:2: error: This file was generated by a newer version of protoc which is
#error This file was generated by a newer version of protoc which is
 ^
/usr/local/Cellar/gazebo7/7.3.1_4/include/gazebo-7/gazebo/msgs/quaternion.pb.h:13:2: error: incompatible with your Protocol Buffer headers.  Please update
#error incompatible with your Protocol Buffer headers.  Please update
 ^
/usr/local/Cellar/gazebo7/7.3.1_4/include/gazebo-7/gazebo/msgs/quaternion.pb.h:14:2: error: your headers.
#error your headers.
 ^
```

So now it seems like some headers that are used by protobuf has been generated by a newer version, and thus it is not able to recognize them. The problem is that there is no other version in [the releases of protobuf page](https://github.com/google/protobuf/releases?after=v3.0.0-alpha-1) so I don't know where the problem comes from.

I'm building all of this in a Mac with gazebo7 installed today and with the latest version of the master firmware.

P.S: If I change the CMakeLists.txt in `Tools/sitl_gazebo` and allow for having protobuf versions above 3.0.0 the simulation executes but without the world.

title: Reboot with forcing to bootloader gets swallowed by MAVLink
LPE: Terrain walking process noise scaling with velocity not valid in all cases
body:
The scaling of the terrain walking process noise with velocity, leads to terrain-jumps when position estimation is lost (or regained). Especially in use cases without GPS this can lead to altitude jumps.

Refer to: https://github.com/PX4/Firmware/blob/master/src/modules/local_position_estimator/BlockLocalPositionEstimator.cpp#L859

Update: Forgot to say, that a workaround is to set LPE_T_MAX_GRADE to 0%, but this disables scaling at all.

title: Battery: directly evaluate critical battery state if set, wait longer…
body:
… for USB detection to happen

Fixes:
- Critical battery warning didn't get issued when critical battery state is set directly
- Battery warnings got issued when only connected via USB which shouldn't happen. I increased the timeout to 6 seconds which works for me with certain margin. However I might not be aware of all the implications here

title: Geofence: fix reset after violation and also if RTL/Loiter switches a…
body:
…re not assigned

**needs a sitl test**

Fixes:
- Geofence actions didn't engage when either the loiter or the return switch were not assigned
- The critical battery warning would not be issued anymore, and the RTL action not be engaged, if there was a geofence violation before that
- Reset the rtl_on state so on a new violation the last state is updated correctly again

title: Fix build errors
body:
When building the firmware, I had the following error:

```
FAILED: parameters.xml 
cd /home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/build_posix_bebop_default && /usr/bin/python /home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/Tools/px_process_params.py -s /home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/src --board CONFIG_ARCH_bebop --xml --inject-xml
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/Tools/px_process_params.py", line 155, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/Tools/px_process_params.py", line 127, in main
    if not parser.Validate():
  File "/home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/Tools/px4params/srcparser.py", line 361, in Validate
    for index in param.GetBitmaskList():
  File "/home/michael/Projects/PX4/Firmware/Tools/px4params/srcparser.py", line 132, in GetBitmaskList
    keys.sort(key=float)
AttributeError: 'dict_keys' object has no attribute 'sort'
```

I am using Arch Linux which uses Python3 by default. Yet, Python3 returns a view when calling `dict.keys()` and the iterator has no `sort()` function. Python2 returns a `list()` instead. The first commit should fix this error.

The second commit adds a missing header include to drivers used on the Parrot Bebop.

title: Navigator mission FOH use previous loiter altitude
body:
- the previous item altitude wasn't valid if switching from LOITER ->MISSION
- fixes #5395

This PR drops _mission_item_previous_alt from navigator mission and instead uses the altitude from the previous position setpoint if it's a position or loiter. When switching from LOITER -> MISSION _mission_item_previous_alt wasn't set properly.

title: MC pos control: realize when we are on the trajectory but passed the target waypoint
body: In the following mission, https://gist.github.com/AndreasAntener/42eb7d7e777cff4baf0c0c01c3a5de4f, the multicopter manages to fly 180 degrees into the wrong direction. This waypoint combination most likely never occurs for multicopters (discovered while analyzing #5270). However what happens is that the MC controller sees a previous and current setpoint where the previous setpoint is on the further end of the trajectory (viewed from the current position). The outcome is a target position setpoint on the trajectory into the direction from previous to current and therefore into the wrong direction. Should be investigated further, having a second pair of eyes to look this over would be appreciated.

title: Sudden, inexplicable mode switch from AUTO to STAB
body:
As discussed at today's meeting, I'm creating an issue and sharing the log.

During one of our auto survey flights two weeks ago, the flight mode suddenly has switch from AUTO to STAB without any reason.
There was no mode change commanded either from RC or QGC.
Also, we did not observe any signal loss (RC, GPS, telemetry), and it occurred only once (we flew with the same codebase and hardware three more times at the same location).

Log is [here on LogMuncher](http://logs.uaventure.com/view/mr8Muek656VLwo2wKzUCtF).

We flew with master, commit fb1fd20.
QGC version used during that flight was release v2.9.7b.

title: param: lock the bus as short as possible
body:
Since the FRAM and the baro are on the same bus on the Pixracer, we
currently need to lock down everything (instead of just this SPI bus)
for the time when the params are written.
Therefore, we need to keep this locking as short as possible.

This change makes the locking even shorter by moving all param_get and
param_name and param_size calls out of the lock.

This resolves #5170 for me.

@LorenzMeier please review.
